io.druid.indexing.overlord

Class HeapMemoryTaskStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.druid.indexing.overlord.HeapMemoryTaskStorage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TaskStorage

    public class HeapMemoryTaskStorage
extends Object
implements TaskStorage
    Implements an in-heap TaskStorage facility, with no persistence across restarts. This class is not thread safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      • getTask

        public com.google.common.base.Optional<Task> getTask(String taskid)
        Description copied from interface: TaskStorage
        Returns task as stored in the storage facility. If the task ID does not exist, this will return an absentee Optional. NOTE: This method really feels like it should be combined with TaskStorage.getStatus(java.lang.String). Expect that in the future.
        Specified by:
        getTask in interface TaskStorage
        Parameters:
        taskid - task ID
        Returns:
        optional task

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(TaskStatus status)
        Description copied from interface: TaskStorage
        Persists task status in the storage facility. This method should throw an exception if the task status lifecycle is not respected (absent -> RUNNING -> SUCCESS/FAILURE).
        Specified by:
        setStatus in interface TaskStorage
        Parameters:
        status - task status

      • getActiveTasks

        public List<Task> getActiveTasks()
        Description copied from interface: TaskStorage
        Returns a list of currently running or pending tasks as stored in the storage facility. No particular order is guaranteed, but implementations are encouraged to return tasks in ascending order of creation.
        Specified by:
        getActiveTasks in interface TaskStorage
        Returns:
        list of active tasks

      • getRecentlyFinishedTaskStatuses

        public List<TaskStatus> getRecentlyFinishedTaskStatuses()
        Description copied from interface: TaskStorage
        Returns a list of recently finished task statuses as stored in the storage facility. No particular order is guaranteed, but implementations are encouraged to return tasks in descending order of creation. No particular standard of "recent" is guaranteed, and in fact, this method is permitted to simply return nothing.
        Specified by:
        getRecentlyFinishedTaskStatuses in interface TaskStorage
        Returns:
        list of recently finished tasks

      • removeLock

        public void removeLock(String taskid,
              TaskLock taskLock)
        Description copied from interface: TaskStorage
        Removes lock state from the storage facility. It is harmless to keep old locks in the storage facility, but this method can help reclaim wasted space.
        Specified by:
        removeLock in interface TaskStorage
        Parameters:
        taskid - task ID
        taskLock - lock state
